Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Expert Handler from Survival checks made to ride beasts.

Talent.Name: Fancy Paint Job
Talent.Description: Upgrade all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made in the presence of Signature Vehicle once.

Talent.Name: Fortified Vacuum Seal
Talent.Description: Increase the hull trauma threshold of Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Fortified Vacuum Seal.

Talent.Name: High-G Training
Talent.Description: When a starship or vehicle being piloted would suffer system strain, may suffer strain up to ranks in High-G Training to prevent an equal amount of system strain.

Talent.Name: Koiogran Turn
Talent.Description: When an opponent has gained the advantage on a starship or vehicle being piloted, may perform a Koiogran Turn maneuver to remove the effects.

Talent.Name: Larger Project
Talent.Description: Signature Vehicle can have a silhouette 1 larger per rank of Larger Project.

Talent.Name: Not Today
Talent.Description: Once per session, spend a Destiny Point to save Signature Vehicle from destruction.

Talent.Name: Overstocked Ammo
Talent.Description: Increase the value of the Limited Ammo quality of any weapons mounted on Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Overstocked Ammo.

Talent.Name: Reinforced Frame
Talent.Description: Signature Vehicle gains Massive 1: when making an attack targeting the ship or vehicle, the Critical rating of any weapon used counts as 1 higher.

Talent.Name: Showboat
Talent.Description: When making a check in a starship or vehicle, may suffer 2 strain to gain [TR] on success or [DE] on failure.

Talent.Name: Signature Vehicle
Talent.Description: Choose one starship or vehicle as Signature Vehicle Upgrade all Mechanics checks made on that vehicle once.

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade the ability of all Mechanics checks made to work on this vehicle once.

Talent.Name: Soothing Tone
Talent.Description: Take a Soothing Tone action; make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Xenology) check[b] to allow a beast to recover strain equal to [SU].

Talent.Name: Spur
Talent.Description: Take a Spur action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Survival check[b] to increase a beast's top speed by 1. The beast suffers 2 strain every round it stays spurred.

Talent.Name: Spur (Improved)
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain to attempt Spur as a maneuver and decrease its difficult to [B]Average ([DI][DI]).[b]

Talent.Name: Spur (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When activating and maintaining Spur, the beast only suffers 1 strain instead of 2.

Talent.Name: Tuned Maneuvering Thrusters
Talent.Description: Increase the handling of Signature Vehicle by 1 per rank of Tuned Maneuvering Thrusters.

Talent.Name: Call 'Em
Talent.Description: Do not add [SE] to combat checks due to the use of the Aim maneuver.

Talent.Name: Disarming Smile
Talent.Description: Take the Disarming Smile action; succeed at an opposed Charm check to lower all defenses of a target by ranks in Disarming Smile until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Don't Shoot!
Talent.Description: Once per session as an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Charm check[b]. On a success, cannot be target of combat checks until the end of the encounter or until making a combat check.

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing
Talent.Description: Suffer 2 strain to perform the Double or Nothing incidental to increase the difficulty of the next check by one. Then, after canceling opposing symbols, double the amount of remaining [AD]

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing the Double or Nothing incidental, after canceling opposing symbols, also double the amount of remaining [SU].

Talent.Name: Double or Nothing (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When performing the Double or Nothing incidental, also double the number of [TR] amd [DE].

Talent.Name: Fortune Favors the Bold
Talent.Description: Once per session as an incidental, suffer 2 strain to flip one dark side Destiny Point to light side.

Talent.Name: Guns Blazing
Talent.Description: As an incidental, suffer 2 Strain to avoid increasing the difficulty of a Ranged (Light) check to attack with two weapons.

Talent.Name: Just Kidding!
Talent.Description: Once per round as an incidental spend 1 Destiny Point to ignore [DE] generated on a social check by the character or any ally in short range.

Talent.Name: Quick Draw (Improved)
Talent.Description: May use Quick Draw twice per round.

Talent.Name: Second Chances
Talent.Description: Once per encounter choose a number of positive dice equal to ranks in Second Changes and reroll them.

Talent.Name: Sorry About the Mess
Talent.Description: Decrease the Critical Rating of a weapon by 1 (to a minimum of 1) against targets that have not yet acted this encounter.

Talent.Name: Spitfire
Talent.Description: After a successful combined check with two Ranged (Light) weapons, additional hits can be allocated to other targets within range of the weapon.

Talent.Name: Up the Ante
Talent.Description: When gambling win 10% more credits per rank of Up the Ante.

Talent.Name: Bad Press
Talent.Description: Once per session, choose an organization and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b]. On success, organization members have their wound thresholds reduced by 1, plus 1 per [SU][SU][SU], until the end of the session.

Talent.Name: Blackmail
Talent.Description: When an NPC exceeds his strain threshold, may spend 1 Destiny Point to convince that NPC to perform a single task of choice instead.

Talent.Name: Cutting Question
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, when making a Coercion skill check, the character may use Deception skill instead.

Talent.Name: Discredit
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, take the Discredit action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b] to upgrade the difficulty of one character's social checks once, plus once for every [AD][AD], until of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Encoded Communique
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of checks to decrypt this character's coded messages without the proper cipher a number of times equal to Computers skill.

Talent.Name: Encouraging Words
Talent.Description: After an engaged ally fails a check, may suffer 1 strain to assist that ally's next check this encounter as an out of turn incidental.

Talent.Name: In The Know
Talent.Description: Once per session while in an enemy facility or vessel, may perform the Inside Knowledge action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b]. Character may then find a single personal scale item with a rarity no greater than Cunning plus 2 previously stashed here, or gain a narrative benefit.

Talent.Name: In The Know (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, make an [B]opposed Decepetion vs Vigilance[b] check with the difficulty downgraded once per rank of In the Know to have a target NPC believe specific false intelligence.

Talent.Name: Informant
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reveal a contact who can shed light on a chosen subject.

Talent.Name: Interjection
Talent.Description: After another character makes a social check, suffer 3 strain to take an interjection incidental make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to add [SU] or [FA] equal to [SU], and [AD] or [TH] equal to [AD] to the check.

Talent.Name: Know-It-All
Talent.Description: Once per session, perfectly recall an important fact previously learned as if a Destiny Point had been spent.

Talent.Name: Plausible Deniability (Improved)
Talent.Description: Take an Improved Plausible Deniability action makes a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Coercion check[b] to convince one bystander per rank of Plausible Deniability to depart quietly.

Talent.Name: Positive Spin
Talent.Description: Whenever any character's Duty would increase, it increases by an additional 1 per rank of Positive Spin.

Talent.Name: Positive Spin (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, if no PC's Duty triggered, make a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Charm check[b] with the difficulty decreased once rank of Positive Spin to have one PC's Duty trigger.

Talent.Name: Researcher (Improved)
Talent.Description: On a successful Knowledge check, character and allies gain automatic [AD] per rank of Researcher on checks to act on those facts until the end of his next turn.

Talent.Name: Supporting Evidence
Talent.Description: When assisting an ally with a Charm, Deception, Leadership, or Negotiation check, add automatic [AD] per rank of Supporting Evidence.

Talent.Name: Thorough Assessment
Talent.Description: Once per session, take a Thorough Assessment action: make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge check[b] to gain Boost dice equal to [SU] that can be distributed during the encounter.

Talent.Name: Twisted Words
Talent.Description: When an incoming social check generates [TH][TH] or [DE], may suffer 1 strain as an incidental to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion on speaker.

Talent.Name: Drive Back
Talent.Description: The Inquisitor may spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD] on a missed Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber combat check to force target to make a move maneuver in a direction of the Inquisitor's choice.

Talent.Name: Armor Master (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Once per round, when the character suffers a Critical Injury, he may suffer 3 strain to take the Armor Master incidental. If he does he reduces the Critical Injury result that he suffers by 10 per point of his soak, to a minimum of 1.

Talent.Name: Baleful Gaze
Talent.Description: When targeted by combat check from within medium range, may spend a Destiny Point to upgrade the difficulty of the check a number of times equal to ranks in Coercion.

Talent.Name: Blind Spot
Talent.Description: The character and allies within short range add automatic [AD] to combat checks they make while benefitting from cover.

Talent.Name: Grapple
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may perform the Grapple maneuver. Until the beginning of the character's next turn, enemies must spend two maneuvers instead of one maneuver to move from engaged range to short range of him.

Talent.Name: No Escape
Talent.Description: May spend [AD][AD] from a Coercion check or [TH][TH] from a foe's Discipline check; that target cannot perform a free maneuver during his next turn.

Talent.Name: Overbalance
Talent.Description: Whenever an enemy engaged with the character makes a combat check, after the attack is resolved, the character may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] to stagger the attacker until the end of the attacker's next turn.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike
Talent.Description: When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber weapon, may suffer 1 strain to change the result to any [B]Easy ([DI])[b] Critical Injury result.

Talent.Name: Prime Positions
Talent.Description: When this character or an ally in short range takes cover, he increases soak against ranged attacks by 1 per rank of Prime Positions until he leaves that cover.

Talent.Name: Prescient Shot
Talent.Description: Add [BO] to all Ranged (Light) checks unless the target is immune to Force powers.

Talent.Name: Prophetic Aim
Talent.Description: While benefiting from an Aim maneuver, [DE] from the character's Ranged (Heavy) and Ranged (Light) checks cannot cause attacks to hit allies engaged with the target.

Talent.Name: Reinforce Item
Talent.Description: Take the Reinforce Item maneuver: commit [LI][LI] to grant one weapon or piece of armor the Cortosis quality while [LI][LI] remains committed. Suffer 3 strain every round [LI][LI] remain committed.

Talent.Name: Suppressing Fire
Talent.Description: The character and each ally within short range may spend [AD] on their failed combat checks to inflict one strain on the target per rank of Supressing Fire. Each character can only activate this effect once per round.

Talent.Name: Calm Commander
Talent.Description: May use ranks in Cool to upgrade Mass Combat checks instead of ranks in Leadership.

Talent.Name: Clever Commander
Talent.Description: May use ranks in Knowledge (Warfare) to upgrade Mass Combat checks instead of ranks in Leadership.

Talent.Name: Commanding Presence (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, may take Commanding Presence action; make an opposed [B]Cool vs. Discipline[b] check to force target to leave the encounter.

Talent.Name: Confidence (Improved)
Talent.Description: May spend [TR] on a fear check to steady the nerves of other allies making the same fear check. If the character does so, each ally within short range who makes the fear check adds automatic [SU] equal to the character's ranks in Confidence to the results of the check.

Talent.Name: Master Instructor
Talent.Description: Once per round as an out of turn incidental, may suffer 2 strain to allow ally to use character's ranks in Discipline for next Discipline check an ally makes.

Talent.Name: Master Strategist
Talent.Description: Once per phase during a mass combat, may suffer 2 strain to decrease difficulty of a Mass Combat check once.

Talent.Name: Natural Instructor
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll one Discipline or Leadership check.

Talent.Name: Ready for Anything
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Ready for Anything on Mass Combat checks and Cool or Vigiliance checks to determine Initiateve order.

Talent.Name: Ready for Anything (Improved)
Talent.Description: When making Cool or Vigilance checks to determine Initiative order, may spend [TR] to add [SU] equal to rnaks in Ready for Anything.

Talent.Name: That's How It's Done
Talent.Description: May suffer 1 strain on successful skill check to add [AD] to the same skill check made by a number of allies equally to Willpower within short range during the next round.

Talent.Name: Well Read
Talent.Description: Choose any 3 Knowledge skills. They permanently become career skills.

Talent.Name: Custom Loadout
Talent.Description: May add 2 additional hard points to Signature Vehicles.

Talent.Name: Cyberneticist
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Cyberneticist from checks to build, repair, and install cybernetic implants . Cybernetics cost 50% less.

Talent.Name: Deft Maker
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Deft Maker from checks to repair, modify, construct, or program droids. Reduce the material cost to craft droids by 50%.

Talent.Name: Engineered Redundancies
Talent.Description: Gain the ability to use emergency repair patches to heal. Additionally, can be healed with Mechanics checks.

Talent.Name: Eye for Detail
Talent.Description: After making a Mechanics or Computers check, may suffer strain up to ranks in Eye for Detail to convert that many [SU] to [AD].

Talent.Name: Energy Transfer
Talent.Description: May suffer 1 strain to use the Energy Transfer meneuver to power up an unpowered device or replenish exhausted ammunition for an energy weapon.

Talent.Name: Machine Mender
Talent.Description: When making a Mechanics check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Machine Mender.

Talent.Name: More Machine Than Man
Talent.Description: Increase cybernetic implant cap by 1 per rank of More Machine than Man.

Talent.Name: Overcharge
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, may use the Overcharge action. Make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b]. On success one installed cybernetic provides additional benefits. On [DE], overcharged cybernetic shorts out.

Talent.Name: Overcharge (Improved)
Talent.Description: May spend [AD][AD] or [TR] from Overcharge action to immediately take another action.

Talent.Name: Supreme Overcharge
Talent.Description: May perform the Overcharge action on any number of installed cybernetics. On [DE], one overcharged cybernetic shorts out.

Talent.Name: Reroute Processors
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, may take a Reroute Processors action, make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to reduce one of a droid's characteristics by 1 and increase another of its characteristics by 1.

Talent.Name: Resourceful Refit
Talent.Description: May perform the Resourceful Refit action, make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to scavenge an old attachment to construct a new one, reducing its price by that of the dismantled attachment.

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary (Improved)
Talent.Description: When directing NPC droids, those droids grand additional [BO] in addition to other benefits.

Talent.Name: Speaks Binary (Supreme)
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, may perform the Speaks Binary maneuver. A number of NPC droids up to ranks in Speaks Binary may use the character's ranks for 1 skill of character's choice.

Talent.Name: Deathblow
Talent.Description: After making a successful attack with a non-starship/vehicle weapon, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage equal to his Willpower to one hit of the successful attack.

Talent.Name: Essential Kill
Talent.Description: When making a non-Gunnery combat check, the character may add [FO] no greater than his Force rating to the check. The character may spend [FP] to add [AD] or [FP][FP][FP] to add [TR] (character's choice) to the result.

Talent.Name: Force Connection
Talent.Description: When the character performs a Survival or Knowledgen(Xenology) skill check, he may roll [FO] no greater than his Force rating. The character may spend [FP] to add [SU] or [AD] (character's choice) to the result.

Talent.Name: Harass
Talent.Description: Whenever the character's bonded animal makes a successful combat check against a target, it may forgo inflicting damage to upgrade the difficulty of the target's next check once instead.

Talent.Name: Holistic Navigation
Talent.Description: When making an Astrogation skill check, the character may spend one Destiny Point to remove [DE], or to remove [TH] equal to his ranks in Perception.

Talent.Name: Intuitive Navigation
Talent.Description: When performing an Astrogation or Knowledge (Outer Rim) skill check, the character may roll [FO] no greater than his Force rating. The character may spend [FP] to ass [SU] or [AD] (character's choice) to the result.

Talent.Name: Marked for Death
Talent.Description: Take the Marked for Death maneuver; commiting [FO]. Add [AD][AD] to combat checks against target while [FO] remains committed but cannot use this talent again until the original target is incapacitated or the session ends.

Talent.Name: Menace
Talent.Description: Enemy within short range of the character's bonded animal adds [SE] to next Combat check made against the character.

Talent.Name: Mind Over Matter
Talent.Description: The character may spend one Destiny Point to recover strain equal to to his Willpower rating.

Talent.Name: One with Nature
Talent.Description: When in the wilderness, the character may make a [B]Simple (-) Survival check[b] instead of Discipline or Cool to recover starin at the end of an encounter.

Talent.Name: Planet Mapper
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Planet Mapper from Streetwise or Survival checks used for navigation on a world. Such checks also take half normal time.

Talent.Name: Shortcut (Improved)
Talent.Description: When engaging in a chase or race, may suffer 2 strain to add [SU] equal to ranks in Shortcut to the check.

Talent.Name: Studious Plotting
Talent.Description: When making a Streetwise or Survival skill check to navigate on a world, the character may use Intellect instead of Cunning.

Talent.Name: Survival of the Fittest
Talent.Description: Once per session, when making a single check the character may treat his Force rating as being equal to ranks in Survival.

Talent.Name: Terrifying Kill
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to take the Terrifying Kill mane.

Talent.Name: Ambush
Talent.Description: Once per round while benefiting from cover, may make the Ambush maneuver. Add damage equal to Stealth skill to one hit of next successful combat check against a target within short range before the end of the turn.

Talent.Name: Cunning Snare
Talent.Description: Once per encounter as an action, amy create a trap. Any other character wh moves to engaged range of the trap must make an [B]Opposed Vigilance vs. Survival check[b] to avoid harm and ill effects.

Talent.Name: Moving Target
Talent.Description: If the character has already acted this round, increase ranged defense by 1 per rank of moving target.

Talent.Name: Seize the Initiative
Talent.Description: Once per session, as a maneuver, may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Athletics check[b]. On success, other PCs may take their turns immediately.

Talent.Name: Domesticable
Talent.Description: Downgrade the difficulty of checks to train this mount by 1 per rank.

Talent.Name: Trained Mount
Talent.Description: Add [BO] per rank to a rider's Survival checks while mounted on this mount.

Talent.Name: Beast of Burden
Talent.Description: Add 1 per rank to the mount's encumbrance threshold.

Talent.Name: Stubborn
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of checks to train this mount by 1 per rank.

Talent.Name: Domesticated
Talent.Description: Difficulty for training this beast is not upgraded.

Talent.Name: Flyer
Talent.Description: This mount can fly. When on the ground, its Speed is reduced to 1.

Talent.Name: Better Luck Next Time
Talent.Description: Take a Better Luck Next Tiem action; make a [B]Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Cool check[b] to force a competitor to suffer a major misfortune.

Talent.Name: Constant Vigilance
Talent.Description: May always use Vigilance when making checks to determine initiative.

Talent.Name: Fear the Shadows
Talent.Description: Perform the Fear the Shadows action: make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Deception check[b] to force a single minion group or rival to flee the encounter.

Talent.Name: Freerunning
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain when making a Move maneuver to move to any location within short range.

Talent.Name: Freerunning (Improved)
Talent.Description: Suffer 4 strain when making a move maneuver to move to any location within medium range.

Talent.Name: Impossible Fall
Talent.Description: Once per session, perform Impossible Fall incidental when falling: make Force power check and spend [FP][FP] to decrese fall by one range band and land somewhere safe. Spend [FP] to decrease distance by one additional range band.

Talent.Name: Reconstruct the Scene
Talent.Description: Perform the Reconstruct the Scene action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to identify the physical characteristics of person present at the scene within 24 hours.

Talent.Name: Saber Throw (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing the Saber Throw action, may increase the range to long range. When attacking a target at long range, spend [FP][FP] to have weapon return to hand.

Talent.Name: Sense the Scene
Talent.Description: Perform the Sense the Scene action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] and add [FO] no greater than Force rating. If successful, spend [FP] to identify the emotional characteristics of one person involved in the crime.

Talent.Name: Street Smarts (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, amy take an Improved Street Smarts action; make a [B]Formidible ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI]) Streetwise[b] or [B]Knowledge (Underworld) check[b] toe learn one vital clue from the GM. Reduce the difficulty oncer per rank of Street Smarts.

Talent.Name: Superhuman Reflexes
Talent.Description: Once per session, after generatin [DE] on a Piloting check cancel the [DE] and add [SU] equal to ranks in Cool.

Talent.Name: Hard-Boiled
Talent.Description: When recovering strain after an encounter, may spend [AD] up to ranks in Hard-Boiled to recover 1 wound per [AD] spent.

Talent.Name: Hindering Shot
Talent.Description: Increase the difficulty of next Gunnery check by 1. If check deals damage, target starship or vehicle suffers system strain equal to speed when it moves until the end of the encounter..

Talent.Name: Iron Body
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Iron Body from Coordination and Resilience checks. Reduce the critical rating of unarmed attacks by 1 per rank of Iron Body (to a minimum of 1).

Talent.Name: Martial Grace
Talent.Description: Once per round, suffers 2 strain to add damage equal to ranks in Coordination to next Brawl check made this turn.

Talent.Name: Offensive Driving
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, suffer system strain up to vehicle's highest defense to upgrade the difficulty of traget's next Piloting check that many times.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per round, when inflicting a Critical Injury with a Brawl or Melee weapon, may suffer 2 strain to change the result to any [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] Critical injury.

Talent.Name: Precision Strike (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When this character inflicts a Critical Injury with a Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber wepaon, may suffer 1 strain to chang the result to any [B]Easy ([DI])[b] Critical Injury.

Talent.Name: Unarmed Parry
Talent.Description: May Parry while unarmed Reduce strain cost to Parry while unarmed by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

Talent.Name: Aggressive Negotiations
Talent.Description: Once per session perform a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Lightsaber check[b] to decrease the difficulty of all Negotiation checks for the rest of the encounter by 2.

Talent.Name: Crucial Point
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may introduce to negotiations and one potential concession that an opponent will do nearly anything to obtain.

Talent.Name: Empty Soul
Talent.Description: If the character is carrying items that total 2 encumbrance or less add [LI][DA] to Force power checks.

Talent.Name: Go Without
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character counts as having the right tools for the job when making a skill check.

Talent.Name: Iron Soul
Talent.Description: When carrying items that total 2 encumbrance or less, at the end of each encounter heal all strain the character is suffering.

Talent.Name: Meditative Trance
Talent.Description: When suffocaring (see [B]Force and Destiny[b] Core Rulebook, page 221), the character suffers 1 strain each round instead of 3. When exposed to vacuum, the character suffers 1 wound each round instead of 3.

Talent.Name: Mind Bleed
Talent.Description: When attacked, the character may choose to suffer strain no greater than the number of wounds suffered from the attack. If he does so, the attacker then suffers a number of wounds equal to the strain suffered by the chartacter.

Talent.Name: Now the Master
Talent.Description: Once per session, choose one talent or Force power that any character in the current encounter possesses. Gain that talent or Force power until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Once A Learner
Talent.Description: As an action, suffer 4 strain and let one ally within short range increase the ally's Force rating by an amount equal to the character's Force rating until the end of the round.

Talent.Name: Savvy Negotiator
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Savvy Negotiator from all Negotiation and Streetwise checks.

Talent.Name: Savvy Negotiator (Improved)
Talent.Description: Make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Negotiation check[b] to convince one bystander per rank of Savvy Negotiator to see one of an opponent's points as maliciously unreasonable.

Talent.Name: Skilled Teacher
Talent.Description: If an ally at short range has lower ranks in a skill than the character, the character may perform a Skilled Teacher incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Skilled Teacher, then add an equal number of [SU] to ally's next check.

Talent.Name: Sunder (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each [AD] spent to activate a weapon's Sunder quality damages an item two steps, instead of one.

Talent.Name: Wise Warrior
Talent.Description: When making a combat check, may perform the Wise Warrior incidental; spend 1 Destiny Point and use any characteristic for the check.

Talent.Name: Wise Warrior (Improved)
Talent.Description: When performing the Wise Warrior incidental, one ally at short range may use the same characteristic for the next combat check the ally makes before the end of the character's next turn.

Talent.Name: Combat Programming
Talent.Description: Once per encounter make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] while repairing or working on a droid. For the remainder of the encounter, the droid gains 1 rank in two different combat skills.

Talent.Name: Construction Specialist
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] equal to ranks in Construction Specialist from checks to construct defenses, positions, fortifications, and similar projects.

Talent.Name: Creative Design
Talent.Description: As part of resolving a successful crafting check, the character may also apply a result equivalent to spending a number of [AD] equal to his ranks in Creative Design. The GM may then apply a result equivalent to spending that same number of [TH].

Talent.Name: Desperate Repairs
Talent.Description: Once per session may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] on one engaged allied droid. If successful, the droid becomes immobilized and staggered for 1 round, then heals all strain and one Critical Injury with a severity rating no greater than [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Design Flaw
Talent.Description: When making a combat check with a personal scale weapon against a droid, may add [AD] equal to ranks of Design Flaw.

Talent.Name: Dockyard Expertise
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b] when at a space dock, if successful, the cost and time for repairs is reduced by 25% per rank of Dockyard Expertise.

Talent.Name: Improvised Defenses
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Survival check[b] to fashion small defenses. It providing cover for up to 4 characters for the rest of encounter.

Talent.Name: Improvised Position
Talent.Description: The character may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group and its vehicles.

Talent.Name: Master Demolitionist
Talent.Description: When resolving an attack from a personal explosive or ordnance weapon, may spend [AD] or [TR] to have the weapon's Blast quality act at short range, or medium if it already acts at short.

Talent.Name: Push the Specs
Talent.Description: Perform the Push the Specs action when in a starship or vehicle, making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. With success, the ship's top speed increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to the characters Intellect.

Talent.Name: Repair Patch Specialization
Talent.Description: Whenever using an emergency repair patch, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Repair Patch Specialization.

Talent.Name: Smart Handling
Talent.Description: Once per session, take the Smart Handling action; making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. Until the start of the next round the ship's handling increases by 2 plus an amount equal to [AD] scored on the check to a maximum handling of +4.

Talent.Name: Weak Foundation
Talent.Description: Once per session may take the Weak Foundation action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b], if successful, for the remainder of the encounter the character and all allies add automatic [AD][AD] or [SU] to all combat checks made targeting the identified fixed structure.

Talent.Name: Alchemical Arts
Talent.Description: After making a check to craft a potion or talisman, may suffer strain up to twice ranks in Alchemical Arts. For every two strain, add [LI] or [DA] to results.

Talent.Name: Channel Agony
Talent.Description: After rolling [FO], may suffer wounds up to twice ranks in Channel Agony to add automatic [DA] for every two wounds suffered to the results.

Talent.Name: Font of Power
Talent.Description: Once per session, may take the Font of Power action. Until the end of the encounter, characters within medium range add automatic [LI] or [DA] to checks based on alignment.

Talent.Name: Identify Ingredients
Talent.Description: After being exposed to a substance, as an out-of-turn incidental, may roll [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP][FP] to immediately identify its composition and effects.

Talent.Name: Improvised Concoction
Talent.Description: Once per session, as an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Xenology) check[b], adding [FO] no greater than Force rating to create 1 dose of a poison or drug with rarity of Intellect + [SU] + [FP] spent or lower.

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura
Talent.Description: Commit [FO]. Add [AD] to social checks equal to [FO] committed. Add [TH] to equal [FO] commited to enemy social checks in short range.

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura (Improved)
Talent.Description: Characters affected by Overwhelming Aura add automatic [FA] to fear checks the character causes and automatic [SU] to fear checks not caused by the character.

Talent.Name: Power of Darkness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Power of Darkness maneuver. Increase wound threshold and strain threshold by 1 per Dark Side Destiny point currently in the Destiny pool until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Secret Lore
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank or Secret Lore from all Knowledge (Lore) checks. Reduce the difficulty of all Knowledge (Lore) checks by 1.

Talent.Name: Transmogrify
Talent.Description: When making a crafting check, may add [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP] to add [SU] and spend [FP][FP] to add [AD] to check.

Talent.Name: Acklay's Scything Strike
Talent.Description: Brawl attacks gain Pierce equal to Force rating.

Talent.Name: Dodge (Improved)
Talent.Description: After using Dodge, can make a Move maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Embrace Your Hate
Talent.Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point and suffer Conflict equal to dark side Destiny Points in pool to add equal damage to melee attack. May use this ability once per encounter per rank.

Talent.Name: Far Strike
Talent.Description: As an action, make a Brawl check as a ranged attack, adding [FO] up to Force rating, increase the range of the attack by one band for each [FP] spent, to a maximum of long.

Talent.Name: Headbutt
Talent.Description: Perform Headbutt incidental, suffering 2 wounds to knock down and disorient enemy.

Talent.Name: Indomitable Will
Talent.Description: Once per encounter as a maneuver, suffer 3 strain to commit [FO] up to Force rating and reduce all damage suffered by an equal amount, but suffer 1 strain per turn.

Talent.Name: Inner Peace
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, convert a number of dark side Destiny Points equal to ranks in Inner Peace to light side Destiny Points and reduce Conflict gained this session.

Talent.Name: Juyo Savagery
Talent.Description: The character adds +5 to Critical injury rolls from Lightsaber attacks for each dark side Destiny Point in the Destiny pool.

Talent.Name: Power From Pain
Talent.Description: Once per session as an incidental, may spend 1 Destiny Point to gain +1 Force rating for each Critical Injury character is suffering until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Sapith Sundering
Talent.Description: May add [FO] up to Force rating to Brawl checks; the attack gains the Sunder quality, and character may spend [FP] generated one the check as [AD] to activate the Sunder quality.

Talent.Name: Toughened (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, may heal wounds equal to ranks in Toughened.

Talent.Name: Vaapad Control
Talent.Description: When making a Lightsaber combat check, the character may suffer 1 strain to downgrade the difficulty of this check a number of times equal to the number of light side Destiny Points in the Destiny pool.

Talent.Name: A Step Ahead
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may suffer 2 strain in order to count his Cunning as one higher than normal for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Analyze Data
Talent.Description: Once per session after capturing enemy data, the character may perfom the Analyze Data action to make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. Once during the remainder of session he may then add [SU] equal to ranks in Knowledge (Warfare) to one check related to that data.

Talent.Name: Cunning Persona
Talent.Description: The character may suffer 2 strain to perform a Charm check with Cunning instead of Presence.

Talent.Name: Exhaustive Questioning
Talent.Description: Whenever a character makes a successful social skill check against a captured enemy within short range, may reduce that enemy’s strain threshold by 2 for the remainder of the session and can spend [AD] to inflict 1 strain.

Talent.Name: Hidden Storage (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may use Hidden Storage to store an item within his own suitably modified body.

Talent.Name: Incite Distraction
Talent.Description: While in a crowd, may perform the Incite Distraction action to make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Deception check[b]. If successful, enemies treat the area as difficult terrain. The character may spend [TR] to make the location impassable terrain to them instead.

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Indistinguishable to a number of allied within short range equal to ranks in Deception.

Talent.Name: Inside Knowledge
Talent.Description: Once per session while in an enemy facility or vessel, may perform the Inside Knowledge action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b]. Character may then find a single personal scale item with a rarity no greater than Cunning plus 2 previously stashed here, or gain a narrative benefit.

Talent.Name: Inside Person
Talent.Description: Once per session the character may spend a Destiny Point to establish he has been undercover in an identified enemy base or large vehicle. For the remainder of the session, add automatic [AD][AD] to checks he or his allies make that are associated with that location.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Know Their Weakness action and choose one target within close range; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to downgrade the difficulty of social skill checks against target once per rank of Know Their Weakness until the end of the session.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Know Their Weakness to a number of enemies within short range equal to his Presence.

Talent.Name: Lose Them
Talent.Description: When being followed or chased, the character may perform the Lose Them action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Stealth check[b]. If successful, add [SE][SE] to checks to follow him for the remainder of the encounter and may spend [TR] to indicate his pursuers have lost him completely.

Talent.Name: Made You Talk
Talent.Description: Once per session, may make an opposed social skill check against a captured enemy character within short range and add [BO] for every 2 strain inflicted on the target that encounter. If successful, the PCs gain a bonus based on the enemy NPC type.

Talent.Name: Pilot Training
Talent.Description: Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning
Talent.Description: When targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Resist Questioning out-of-turn incidental, adding [SE] to the check. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate he has provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning (Improved)
Talent.Description: When one ally within short range is targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may perform Resist Questioning to affect this check instead. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate the ally provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Adaptable
Talent.Description: [H4]Adaptable[h4] When resolving a check that uses a skill in which they nave no ranks, the character may spend one Destiny Point to remove [DE] from the check or to remove [TH] equal to their ranks in Cool from the check.

Talent.Name: Another's Treasure
Talent.Description: [H4]Another's Treasure[h4] The condition of an item does not affect the price the character receives when selling it. In addition, the character can always find a buyer for an item, no matter its condition or how useless or worthless it may seem. The details of the transaction are subject to the GM’s discretion, as always, and a buyer might not be immediately (or easily) available.

Talent.Name: Assault Drop
Talent.Description: [H4]Assault Drop[h4] Once per session while piloting a vehicle or ship, the character may perform the Assault Drop incidental. All passengers aboard or allies engaged with the vehicle or ship may immediately disembark or embark as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Backroom Deal
Talent.Description: [H4]Backroom Deal[h4] Once per encounter, the character may take the Backroom Deal action, making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Negotiation check.[b] If the check succeeds the character (or player) reveals how their previously unknown dealings have a meaningful impact on the current scene or encounter. The nature of the revelation and its impact on the scene are ultimately subject to the GM's discretion, but they should give a significant advantage to the PCs. If the check fails and generates [DE], however, the GM may decide that the character's disastrously failed deal has negative repercussions.

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll
Talent.Description: [H4]Barrel Roll[h4] When a vehicle or starship the character is piloting suffers a hit from a combat check, after damage is calculated but before armor is applied, the character may take a Barrel Roll incidental. Their ship suffers 3 system strain, and the damage of that hit is reduced by an amount equal to their ranks in the Piloting skill used for that vehicle. This talent may only be used once per attack and only when the character is piloting a vehicle or starship of silhouette 3 or less.

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Barrel Roll (Improved)[h4] When the character takes the Barrel Roll incidental, reduce Ihe damage of all hits (instead of only one hit) of the attack by the character's ranks in the relevant Piloting skill.

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll (Supreme)
Talent.Description: [H4]Barrel Roll (Supreme)[h4] When the character uses Barrel Roll to reduce the damage from a weapon with the Auto-fire, Blast, or Guided item qualities, they may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] to inflict one hit on the attacker or another enemy vehicle or starship within close range after the initial attack resolves. The hit deals the base damage of the original attack.

Talent.Name: Beginner's Luck
Talent.Description: [H4]Beginner's Luck[h4] Once per session when the character makes a check , the character may add [SU] equal to the number of light side Destiny Points in the Destiny pool to the results.

Talent.Name: Clanker Killer
Talent.Description: [H4]Clanker Killer[h4] Before rolling a combat check that targets a droid (including a droid vehicle or a vehicle piloted by a droid), the character may remove [BO] up to their ranks in Clanker Killer from the pool, and add an equal number of [SU] or [AD] (in any combination) to the results.

Talent.Name: Consider our Options
Talent.Description: [H4]Consider Our Options[h4] The character may take the Consider Our Options action, makings [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Negotiation check.[b] If the check succeeds, until the start of the character's next turn, any enemy who attacks the character suffers 2 strain, plus 1 strain per additional [SU][SU] on the character's check, before resolving the attack. (If this strain causes an adversary to become incapacitated, the GM may determine that adversary simply bows out of the fight.) The effect ends immediately if the character inflicts damage on an enemy.

Talent.Name: Consider our Options (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Consider Our Options (Improved)[h4] When the character takes the Consider Our Options action, the character may choose to have the effects also apply to attacks that target the character’s allies who are within short range. The effects end for all characters if the character or an affected ally inflict damage on an enemy.

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications
Talent.Description: [H4]Exceed Specifications[h4] Before making a check using an item, the character may take the Exceed Specifications incidental, adding [BO] to the check. The GM may spend [TH][TH] on the check to damage the item one step, or [DE] to damage it beyond usability (see [B]Table 5-4: Repairing Gear[b] in any core rulebook). [TH] or [DE] may have additional consequences depending on the nature of the item, at the GM's discretion.

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Exceed Specifications (Improved)[h4] When the character takes the Exceed Specifications incidental, upgrade the ability of the check once instead of adding [BO].

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications (Supreme)
Talent.Description: [H4]Exceed Specifications (Supreme)[h4] If the character's check benefitting from the Exceed Specifications incidental generates [TR], they may damage the item one step to roll one additional [PR] and add it to the check results. If the check generates [DE] roll [CH] and add it to the check results.

Talent.Name: Fire Support
Talent.Description: [H4]Fire Support[h4] After the character makes a successful combat check using a vehicle weapon, the next ally to make a check adds [BO] equal to the character's ranks of Fire Support.

Talent.Name: Fire When Ready
Talent.Description: [H4]Fire When Ready[h4] The character may take the Fire When Ready action, making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check.[b] If the check succeeds, the character chooses a number of crew aboard their ship equal to their Presence. Those crew members downgrade the difficulty of their next Gunnery check once, plus one time for every additional [SU][SU] on the check.

Talent.Name: First Among Brothers
Talent.Description: [H4]First Among Brothers[h4] When the character makes a check that does not result in any uncanceled [TH], add [AD] equal to the character's ranks in First Among Brothers to the check results. The character may only spend these additional [AD] to affect allied clones.

Talent.Name: For the Republic!
Talent.Description: [H4]For The Republic![h4] Once per encounter when an ally is incapacitated or killed, the character may perform the For the Republic! incidental. The character makes a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check.[b] If the check succeeds, the ally is not incapacitated or killed until the end of the following round, instead. If the character's wounds or strain are reduced below their threshold before the end of the next round, they are not incapacitated.

Talent.Name: Guardian of the Republic
Talent.Description: [H4]Guardian of the Republic[h4] After the character uses Parry or Reflect to reduce damage to an ally, that ally cannot be targeted by combat checks for the remainder of the round.

Talent.Name: Hyperspace Assault
Talent.Description: [H4]Hyperspace Assault[h4] The character may use Astrogation or Knowledge (Warfare) to determine their Initiative during an encounter in which they are piloting or commanding a starship. If they do so, they may spend [TR] from the check to choose the starting locations of all allied ships in the encounter.

Talent.Name: Lateral Thinking
Talent.Description: [H4]Lateral Thinking[h4] Once per encounter after an enemy succeeds on a check targeting the character, the character may spend one Destiny Point to force the enemy to reroll the check. If the enemy is a droid, the character does not spend a Destiny Point to use this talent.

Talent.Name: Learning Opportunity
Talent.Description: [H4]Learning Opportunity[h4] Once per round, the character may spend [AD][AD][AD] from a check they fail to upgrade the ability of their next check once.

Talent.Name: Leverage
Talent.Description: [H4]Leverage[h4] The character removes [SE] per rank of Leverage from their Cool and Negotiation checks.

Talent.Name: Mission Critical
Talent.Description: [H4]Mission Critical[h4] Once per session after rolling a Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting (Space) check but before resolving it, the character may spend a Destiny Point to add [SU] or [AD] to the results equal to their ranks in that skill. (The character may divide the results between [SU] and [AD] In any combination.)

Talent.Name: Natural Operator
Talent.Description: [H4]Natural Operator[h4] Once per game session, the character may reroll any one Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting (Space) check.

Talent.Name: Natural Trooper
Talent.Description: [H4]Natural Trooper[h4] Once per game session, the character may reroll anyone Gunnery or Ranged (Heavy) check.

Talent.Name: One Person's Trash
Talent.Description: [H4]One Person's Trash[h4] The character may make a Perception check in order to locate a particular item amid a battlefield, shipwreck, junkyard, or other location with potential salvage. The difficulty of the check is equal to half the item's rarity, rounded down. There is no cost to acquire an item this way, but the item is in need of Moderate repairs (see [B]Table 5-4: Repairing Gear[b] in any of the core rulebooks) when found.

Talent.Name: On My Order
Talent.Description: [H4]On My Order[h4] The character may take the On My Order action, making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership Check.[b] If the check succeeds, the character chooses a number of crew aboard their ship equal to their Presence. Those crew members upgrade the ability of their next Gunnery check once, plus one time for every additional [SU][SU] on the check.

Talent.Name: Ordnance Saturation
Talent.Description: [H4]Ordnance Saturation[h4] When the character or an ally who is currently benefiting from On My Order or Fire When Ready activates the Blast quality of a planetary-scale weapon, all ships or vehicles within close range of the target suffer damage equal to the weapon's Blast quality (plus 1 per additional [SU] as usual).

Talent.Name: Outmaneuver
Talent.Description: [H4]Outmaneuver[h4] The character may take the Outmaneuver action, making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check.[b] If the check succeeds, the character chooses one enemy ship or vehicle in the current encounter for each [SU]. Until the end of the character's next turn, the chosen ships must perform one extra maneuver in order to move or change range bands relative to the characters ship or allies.

Talent.Name: Ravage
Talent.Description: [H4]Ravage[h4] Once per encounter, the character may suffer 3 strain to add [FO] up to their current Force rating to a combat check targeting an engaged opponent. The character may spend [FP] to add [SU] or [AD] to the results of the check. If the rules for Morality in [B]Force and Destiny[b] are in use, a character who has purchased this talent gains 1 Conflict at the beginning of each game session.

Talent.Name: Renegade Form
Talent.Description: [H4]Renegade Form[h4] When the character purchases this talent, they choose one characteristic. They may use this characteristic in place of Brawn when making Lightsaber checks

Talent.Name: Respected Delegate
Talent.Description: [H4]Respected Delegate[h4] The character downgrades the difficulty of social skill checks made to interact with government institutions outside of their homeworld a number of times equal to their ranks in Respected Delegate.

Talent.Name: Scrap 'Em!
Talent.Description: [H4]Scrap 'Em![h4] After making a successful combat check, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Scrap 'em! incidental. The character selects a number of allies no greater than their ranks in Leadership. Those allies Add [BO] to their combat checks against the character's target until the start of the character's next turn.

Talent.Name: Scrap 'Em! (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Scrap 'Em! (Improved)[h4] When the character takes the Scrap 'em! incidental, they affect a number of allies no greater than twice their ranks In Leadership, and affected allies add [BO][BO] to combat checks (instead of [BO]).

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Force
Talent.Description: [H4]Secrets of the Force[h4] Knowledge (Lore) and Lightsaber become career skills for the character.

Talent.Name: Side by Side
Talent.Description: [H4]Side By Side[h4] While the character is wielding a lightsaber and engaged with one or more allies also wielding a lightsaber, add [TH] to all combat checks that target the character or those allies. (If multiple allied characters in the engagement possess this talent, the effects are cumulative.)

Talent.Name: Sincerest Flattery
Talent.Description: [H4]Sincerest Flattery[h4] Once per encounter when the character makes a check using a skill that another character has previously used during the encounter, they add [BO][BO].

Talent.Name: Something to Prove
Talent.Description: [H4]Something To Proce[h4] Once per session ihe character may suffer 4 strain in order to reroll a failed check. If the check succeeds, the character heals 4 strain.

Talent.Name: Tactical Advance
Talent.Description: [H4]Tactical Advance[h4] While in cover, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Tactical Advance incidental. Until the end of the character's next turn, the character and allies within short range may move out of cover and continue to receive its benefits.

Talent.Name: Tactical Advance (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Tactical Advance (Improved)[h4] The character may spend [AD][AD] from any check they make or [TH][TH] from a combat check targeting them to perform the Tactical Advance incidental (instead of suffering strain).

Talent.Name: Temple Training
Talent.Description: [H4]Temple Training[h4] Before making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage to the attack equal to their ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Talent.Name: Translation Error
Talent.Description: [H4]Translation Error[h4] Once per encounter, the character may remove [DE] from the results of a social skill check they make.

Talent.Name: Utility Belt (Improved)
Talent.Description: [H4]Utility Belt (Improved)[h4] Once per session when the character performs a Utility Belt incidental, they may produce up to five functionally identical items.

Talent.Name: Will of the Force
Talent.Description: [H4]Will of the Force[h4] Once per round after failing a skill check, the character may convert one dark Side Destiny Point to a light side Destiny Point.

Talent.Name: Cunning Stunt
Talent.Description: Use Cunning instead of Presence for Cool checks.

Talent.Name: Finesse
Talent.Description: Use Agility instead of Brawn for Brawl or Melee checks.

Talent.Name: Tenacious
Talent.Description: Upgrade the number of advantages needed to score a critical hit against the target a number of times equal to his ranks in Tenacious. Also, reduce a Critical Injury result he suffers by 10 per rank of Tenacious

Talent.Name: Altered Deal
Talent.Description: Once per session may take the Altered Deal action and make [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Coercion check[b] to radically change a previously made deal or bargain to the character's advantage.

Talent.Name: Combat Veteran
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] to his Brawl and Discipline checks equal to his ranks in Combat Veteran.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, take Comrades in Arms action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check[b]. If successful, the character plus one ally per [SU] within medium range gains +1 defense for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms (Improved)
Talent.Description: Spend [AD][AD][AD] or [TR] from Comrades in Arms check to also gain +1 soak or give one affected ally +1 soak.

Talent.Name: Disciple of Lore
Talent.Description: Once per round, may suffer 1 strain to decrease the difficulty of next Knowledge (Lore) check a number of times equal to ranks in Disciple of Lore.

Talent.Name: Disciplined Soul
Talent.Description: Spend one Destiny Point after making a Discipline check to spend a number of [TH] not exceeding ranks in Knowledge (Lore) as [AD].

Talent.Name: Disorienting Strike
Talent.Description: After failing a Lightsaber combat check, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to disorient opponents for three rounds.

Talent.Name: Double-Talk
Talent.Description: The character may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] from a successful Charm or Deception check to disorient a number of opponents within short range equal to his Presence for remainder of round and next two rounds.

Talent.Name: Extended Reach
Talent.Description: While armed with a two-handed melee weapon, may suffer one strain to make a Melee combat check with that weapon targeting an enemy at up to short range (rather than engaged range).

Talent.Name: Fearsome Rep
Talent.Description: Add automatic [AD] to the results of Coercion checks equal to ranks in Fearsome Rep.

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics
Talent.Description: May take the Formation Tactics action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, he may choose a number of allies within short range equal to [SU] generated. Upgrade the difficulty of attacks against these allies once until the end of his next turn.

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics (Improved)
Talent.Description: The difficulty of Formation Tactics is reduced to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b]. May spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD][AD][AD] to have effect last until the end of encounter.

Talent.Name: Inspiring Leadership
Talent.Description: Take the Inspiring Leadership action by making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, a number of allies not exceeding his rating in Presence within short range add automatic [SU] to their next skill check.

Talent.Name: Most Impressive
Talent.Description: Spend [TR] from any skill check to allow a number of alies not exceeding the character's rating in Presence within short range to add automatic [AD] to their next check.

Talent.Name: Persistent Targeting
Talent.Description: After making one or more successful combat checks against a target, add [BO] to combat checks against that same target for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy
Talent.Description: Choose one starship or vehicle character owns with a silhouette or 4 or higher; it becomes his 'Pride and Joy' vessel. He upgrades the ability of all social skill checks he makes while within short range of the vessel once.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Improved)
Talent.Description: While inside his Pride and Joy vessel, recover 1 additional strain whenever recovering strain and spend [AD] on checks made to recover strain to allow an ally also within the vessel to recover one strain.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When inside his Pride and Joy vessel, once per session as an incidental, the character may reduce its silhouette by 2 (to a minimum of 0) for the remainder of the round and the following round.

Talent.Name: Push Aside
Talent.Description: After making a successful Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check against an engaged foe, may force the foe to move to short range in a direction of the opponent's choosing. Spend [TR] to cause the opponent to fall prone after moving.

Talent.Name: Seen A Lot of Things
Talent.Description: Whenever the character fails a Knowledge check, he may spend [AD][AD][AD] to roll the check again during his next turn.

Talent.Name: Steady Aim
Talent.Description: The character does not lose the benefits of the Aim maneuver if he performs other maneuvers (including moving) or actions. He does lose the benefits of the Aim maneuver if the encounter ends.

Talent.Name: Targeted Firepower
Talent.Description: Once per session may take Targeted Firepower action; identify one enemy target and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range of character add [AD] to attacks against target equal to [SU] gained in the check.

Talent.Name: Temple Training
Talent.Description: Before making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage to the attack equal to his ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Talent.Name: Trust No One
Talent.Description: When targeted by a social check, may choose to suffer one strain to add automatic [FA] to the check. If the check fails with [DE], the character may immediately perform a maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: By the Book
Talent.Description: Once per encounter before making a combat check, the character may suffer two strain to add [AD] to the results equal to his ranks in By the Book.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi (Improved)
Talent.Description: Discipline becomes a career skill. Secrets of the Jedi may also be used when installing mods on lightsabers.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi
Talent.Description: Lightsaber becomes a career skill. He may also decrease to difficulty of checks made to construct or repair lightsaber hilts a number of times equal to half his ranks in Knowledge (Lore) (rounded up), to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Knows the Ropes
Talent.Description: Add [BO] to checks made to escape from restraints equal to ranks in Knowledge (Underworld). Spend [TR] to free all other allies withing short range.

Talent.Name: Know the Enemy
Talent.Description: The character may use Knowledge (Warfare) skill when making checks to determine Initiative.

Talent.Name: As the Force Wills It
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Knowledge (Lore) check[b] to heal strain at the end of an encounter. [TR] can be spent to heal all strain.

Talent.Name: Trust the Captain
Talent.Description: May take the Trust the Captain action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range increase their ranks in Discipline by an amount equal to ranks in Trust the Captain.

Talent.Name: Prepare to be Boarded!
Talent.Description: Once per encounter may take Prepare to be Boarded! action and make [B]opposed Coercion vs. Discipline check[b] against enemy ship captain. If successful, the enemy suffers 1 strain per uncancelled [SU] and surrenders ship if he exceeds strain threshold. May also spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD] to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion.
